EXTRACTED VALUE: It's just run-of-the-mill game design. Bar the occasionally impressive combat, Beowulf doesn't have enough to make it stand out.
If you like to be tortured, you could just go to the store right now and pick up the game; you'll be very satisfied.
Battle royale effectively spruces up an otherwise dull game, but even this mode isn’t an ultimate savior.
Only the most experienced real-time strategy players will be able to make sense of it, much less enjoy it.
This not a good game. It's not an outright right failure either, but with limited gaming funds and time I suggest giving this title a wide berth.
War has rarely been this uninspiring and run-of-the-mill.
Sneak King gets stale ridiculously fast. At least the achievements are easy.
In conclusion, Battlezone joins that ragged band of Xbox Live Arcade titles that, even for a mere 400 points, don’t deserve to grace your hard drive.
And the core game is familiar territory these days -- familiar to the point of contempt.
A slapdash, sloppy and unimaginative retrofit. [Jan 2002, p.232]
